name: Nodegem WebApi
description: The backbone of the Nodegem program. It's the middleman between the web client and the client services.

AppSettings:Host.description: The host domain for where the front-end will live. (If self-hosted then set it to <your_app_name>.herokuapp.com)

AppSettings:SecretKey.description: Secret key used value encryption and decryption

TokenSettings:Issuer.description: The domain that heroku gives you aka. <your_app_name>.herokuapp.com.

CorsSettings:AllowedHosts.description: Domains that are allowed to hit your api. Typically you allow your front-end if it's running elsewhere. (Comma seperated)

SelfHosted.description: Is this site also hosting the front-end? (true/false)

PROCFILE.description: Which app do you want to run? (WebApi/Procfile or ClientService/Procfile)

USERNAME.description: Nodegem username (only set this if you are running the client service)

PASSWORD.description: Nodegem password (only set this if you are running the client service)

ENDPOINT.description: Domain to connect to Nodegem API (only set this if you are running the client service)
